comments:
Now that the Web services plugins are in the builds, if the user just download 
the build and try to run the Web services wizard, it would failed because the 
third party JARs are missing.  We need a way to check for the existence of 3rd 
party JARs before proceeding with the wizard.  We could copy what the XML 
plugin did for checking for xerces JARs.
With the 0210 driver, I found that if the 3rd party JARs are not there, the Web 
services category don't even show up in the New wizard or preference (nothing 
in the console or .log either). So it's not sure where this check can be added 
to.
With the 0217 I-build, without the 3rd party JARs, the Web service preference 
is presence in the preference page and the Web service category is showing up 
under the New wizard.  Here's the error in the console when trying to invoke 
the Web service client wizard:

Patches committed with further changes. I added <import>s to the plugin.xml 
files of the org.eclipse.wst.wsdl and org.eclipse.wst.ws plugins to the new 
org.eclipse.wst.common.dependencychecker to avoid PDE errors. I organized 
imports on one file to eliminate an unused import to avoid Java warnings.
Verified in M3.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
